title: In Rails 8.1.0 (ActionPack), action method names starting with "_" are not allowed. Why do you think controller action method names can't start with "_" ?
body:
## In Rails 8.1.0 (ActionPack), action method names starting with "\_" are not allowed. Why do you think controller action method names can't start with "\_" ? 

Why do you decide what names are allowed and what aren't? For example, **I use underscores specifically for "inner" actions in a controller**.

In ActionPack:
actionpack (8.1.0) lib/abstract_controller/base.rb:100:in 'AbstractController::Base#action_methods :
```ruby
      def action_methods
        @action_methods ||= begin
          # All public instance methods of this class, including ancestors except for
          # public instance methods of Base and its ancestors.
          methods = public_instance_methods(true) - internal_methods
          # Be sure to include shadowed public instance methods of this class.
          methods.concat(public_instance_methods(false))
          methods.reject! { |m| m.start_with?("_") }
          methods.map!(&:name)
          methods.to_set
        end
      end
```
Previous versions didn't have this (```methods.reject! { |m| m.start_with?("_") }```), and then suddenly, bam, it appeared! Why is that?

## Expected behavior
Please return everything to how it was before â€” it's not up to you to decide whether I can use methods with start underscore for actions or not.

### System configuration

**Rails version**: 8.1.0

**Ruby version**: 3.4.7
